questions.question: What is Mr. Utterson?
What is his relationship with Mr. Enfield?
What sight inspires Enfield to tell Utterson a story in Chapter 1?
What did Mr. Enfield witness Hyde do?
Why did Mr. Enfield and the doctor want to punish Hyde?

choices.answer: he ran over a child without looking back
there was something about him that made them hate him

questions.question: What does "your tale has gone home" mean?

choices.answer: I already know part of this story
You're story has come to its conclusion

questions.question: What is continually mentioned in descriptions of Hyde?

choices.answer: a deformity that can't be named

questions.question: Why is Jekyll's will referred to as Utterson's "eyesore"?

choices.answer: it has unprofessional clauses and is handwritten
Jekyll's handwriting is really hard to read
it doesn't leave any money to Utterson

questions.question: Who is Dr. Lanyon?

choices.answer: An old friend of Utterson's and Jeckll's
the doctor that found the trampled girl
the man who helped Jekyll write his will
the doctor who found Carew's body

questions.question: Why does Utterson want to see Hyde's face so badly?

choices.answer: he can't believe someone could possibly be that ugly
He wants to set his mind at rest
He wants to beat him up
He wants to convince him to leave Jekyll alone

questions.question: Why does Hyde give Utterson his address?

choices.answer: So Utterson can come visit him for tea
to trick Utterson into visiting so Hyde can kill him
so he knows where to send the money from the will

questions.question: What does Utterson think Hyde is doing?

choices.answer: trampling little girls day and night

questions.question: What effect does Hyde have on others?

choices.answer: He makes them want to run away.
He makes them feel evil thoughts.

questions.question: What is a hide-bound pedant?

choices.answer: someone who is conservative and narrow-minded
someone who doesn't care what others have to say

questions.question: What does Utterson promise Jekyll?

choices.answer: He'll help him get rid of Hyde.
He'll follow the will and give Hyde his rights.

questions.question: Why did Hyde kill Carew?
What did Carew have on his person?
What does Jekyll declare after hearing of Hyde's crime?

choices.answer: that he'll help the police find him
that he still feels bad for Hyde
that he'll have nothing more to do with Hyde
that he knows why Hyde did it

questions.question: Where does Jekyll say he got the letter from Hyde?
What concerns Utterson about the origin of the letter?

choices.answer: Poole says no one delivered a letter that day.
the post office was closed that day
it's postmarked from a nearby house
it's dated from two weeks ago

questions.question: What does Guest discover about the letter from Hyde?

choices.answer: it's written in the same handwriting as a letter from Jekyll
it will help clear Jekyll's name
it will help the police find Hyde

questions.question: What is Utterson's conclusion?

choices.answer: Jekyll forged the letter to protect Hyde.
Hyde is hiding in Jekyll's house.
Jekyll is still being blackmailed by Hyde.
